5553504: This convenient apartment with a private courtyard is perfect for people needing a home away from home while working or visiting Broken Hill. It is fully equipped, comfortable and close to the train station, art galleries, restaurants and cafclubs, shops, cinema and supermarket. A house manual, including Wi-Fi details, a local map and brochures are provided on arrival. Need to check in before 4.00 pm? It may be possible by prior arrangement.'

3591235: Retro fun! Stylishly renovated space with heaps of 60s features retained. Excellent array of treats for weary travellers and a great location with easy walking distance of downtown Broken Hill.
107317570: Gigi's place is in a great location and has everything you need. We loved the fruit loaf.
21427544:
Conveniently located in the town centre area. 

Kitchen well equipped, including a grater so we could make cheeseslaw!

Clean and cheerful. Bed was comfortable. Heating when needed (June) was great with electric blankets to take off the chills.

Recommended :)
7535114: Ghislaine's place is quaint, homely and very clean.  Although a little out dated it actually allowed for an authentic experience of Broken Hill.   We enjoyed that it was totally private and we had it to ourselves and we had all we required for a longer stay including our own private garage.   Thank you so much Gigi
19890041: Gigi’s apartment was well presented, clean with many thoughtful touches and well located near the main Street.  Gigi was very friendly and helpful to us.  We would stay there again.
75475883: If you go to Broken Hill and stay elsewhere, you’re a bloody idiot. Gigi is a wonderful accommodating host, the location is perfect and the house a quirky, cosy, aesthetically pleasing vintage bnb. Best ever.
46597956: Great location, so convenient to Broken Hill CBD.
173569118: This is a true gem and has everything needed for a comfortable stay. Very convenient to the CBD and everything else. Not new but spacious and very comfortable. Highly recommended
66426472:
Ghislaine’s heritage cottage is in a great location close enough to walk to the centre of town. The accomodation  is in a besser brick addition to the back of the original cottage . The addition dates to maybe the 60’s but it is very clean and Ghislaine provided many thoughtful touches such as the fresh fruit loaf. Ghislaine is a great communicator and responded immediately to all enquires. The garage door was tricky but Ghislaine is on track to have that upgraded.  The courtyard is lovely 
Thank you Ghislaine for adding to extra enjoyment of our stay in Broken Hill with your knowledge sharing of local information.
35122039: Lovely BNB with a sunny courtyard and so cloes to the Silly Goat cafe and the main street.
43166610: What a lovely little place to retreat from the heat and feel at home. Thanks Gigi! looking forward to coming again
86458785:
Great stay! beautiful little property with a very unique style.
Lots of colour, lovely courtyard and in a great location
Cannot recommend this property enough! 
Thanks again Gigi :)
117283953: Centrally located, feels homely. Supplied with breakfast. Host is friendly but insistent on meeting up. The lane on which it is situated is dark at night. The garage is fairly small and would have difficulty with large vehicles. The alternative is to park in the nearby street as you can't park in the lane. The house was neat and tidy and the hostess was happy to provide with information/ recommendations.
213501095: Very good experience with Gigi. Good location as well, can walk to CBD. Highly recommend if you travel as a couple or small group.

19920380: Sulphide Room: stay for a night, week or longer

The house is within walking distance to town so no car is required and there is a beautiful park across the road. The house is a heritage house giving a true Broken Hill experience while enjoying the many delights Broken Hill has to offer. Guests can walk from the train station or the bus terminal. If flying in a taxi can get you here for about $20.Bedrooms are spacious, clean and have comfortable beds. Kitchen facilities are basic as the kitchen is currently being updated.'

15368381: Jenny is a really great host, very friendly and easygoing, helpful and welcoming. The rooms are beautifully furnished and spotlessly clean, very comfortable beds with excellent linen. We knew the kitchen was being renovated but everything you need to make a meal was there. Very short walk to town. Highly recommended
261692869: Great location. Really nice host. Great facilities.  Highly recommend
12659481: A delightful place to stay that lives up to its high reputation!
7535114: Jenny is really lovely, very prompt with her reply's and gave clear instructions.   The bed was very comfortable and the room spacious and clean.    It is very central and a short walk to town.  If visiting Broken Hill or passing through and require a short stay, highly recommended.
34229003: Jenny’s place was very clean and comfortable with stylish decor. The house has a lovely outlook over the park and is within easy walking distance to the centre of town. Jenny couldn’t have done more to make us welcome and our stay enjoyable. We heartily recommend it.
196674: What great place to stay. The house was spic and span. Jenny was very helpful in suggesting places to eat and see in Broken Hill.
252726348: Great spot  would recommend it to anyone.
57572866: This is a great place to stay. A beautiful house with comfortable places to sit and relax and only a few minutes walk from the centre of town. Jenny is a top host and terrific company.
36233319: Well laid out property. Great hospitality and communication. Only a few minutes walk to Main Street.
49483584:
Beautiful and peaceful house. The whole house was very clean, and the room was really large and beautiful. The room had everything needed including clean towels, plenty of cupboard space, and a desk.
It was a great location, close to the main streets and had a beautiful park across the road.
Jenny was a lovely host, very warm and welcoming, but also gave you privacy.  
Overall wonderful experience.
144062167: Thanks so much for the stay at your lovely place, Jenny. We appreciated your nice touches around the place and loved that we could easily walk into town for dinner last night after our long day in the car. I hope we didn’t disturb you too much this morning with the creaking floorboards as we left.
167664199: Great stylish place, truly brings out the classic beauty of Broken Hill. A total recommend.
61587344: Another fabulous stay with Jenny at broken hill. Her home is beautiful, well located and Jenny is a top host!
135591420:
Such a great place for a few days stay
Well located Nice n comfy bed all of the amenities you need 
And lovely AirCon 
Jenny is very easy to get along with and had some great tips on places to visit
148614482: I had a great experience staying at Jenny’s house. It is a beautiful character home, very clean and tidy and in a great location. Very good value for money and I would stay there again for sure. The rooms are large and have everything you need, there is a very nice park right across the road and you are within walking distance of the main shops. I would highly recommend this Airbnb.
222917584: Awesome experience, Lovely place to stay and friendly host
43166610: Very spacious, lovely rooms in a grand old house. Jenny is very helpful and the location is perfect, right next to the park
80345680:
Large spacious room in period home. Some squeaky floor boards. 
Everything spotlessly clean. 
Great location close to town, restaurants and amenities. 
Jenny is friendly and sociable without being over-the-top. In summary, the ideal host.

150621: Our house was built in 1939 for the Chief Mines Inspector. It is a solid concrete wall and floor building situated on a half acre overlooking the main City of Broken Hill with views of the Line of Lode and the regeneration reserve and Living Desert.'

9802605: Ron and Margaret’s place is beautiful Nd comfortable. Cool air conditioned room on a hot day. Thank you for having me :)

5107244: Although situated in a quiet street this charming house is close to the centre of our heritage-listed town. The train station, boutiques, cafclubs, restaurants, cinema, supermarket and art galleries are all accessible on foot. Both your room and private bathroom are clean and comfortable and you will be the only guest(s) in the house. Enjoy the indoor/outdoor relaxation areas when not out and about. A quality continental breakfast is provided at your preferred time. Just sit back and chill! translated by Google Although situated in a quiet street this charming house is close to the heart of our national heritage-listed city and yoube able to access most points of interest on foot. Both your room and private bathroom are clean and comfortable and you will be the only guest(s) in the house. A quality continental breakfast is provided at your preferred time. So just sit back and chill out! Need to check in before 4.00 pm? It may be possible by prior arrangement.'

7994640: We really enjoyed our stay in Broken Hill, Gigi's place is easy walking distance to many sites. Gigi is a wonderful host
65982843:
You can’t go wrong here. Gigi is a lovely host and her home is immaculate. Gigi even includes breakfast ( juice cereal yoghurt fruit toast) YUM!
Access is excellent with a gentle sloping ramp for those who need it.
157328716: We had a lovely stay at Ghislaine's. A comfortable room, in walking distance to the town centre. Breakfast with Ghislaine's personal touch was lovely and appreciated. Will stay on our way home again.
58219120: Lovely to stay with you. Very central and near all the best dinners.

34259844: Outback Comfort & Style | AC, WiFi,  Pet Friendly

Centenary Cottage is a stylish and spacious 2 bedroom outback cottage with modern comforts. It features a well equipped kitchen, laundry, air conditioning, smart TV and free Wifi. It is well located in a quiet residential area a short drive from the centre of Broken Hill. It is an ideal place to stay for a few days to refresh and explore Broken Hill and the surrounds.'

673032: We loved Ben and Emma's house in Broken Hill, it was very stylish and with all the comforts we needed for a lovely wintery break. The house in a great spot, just a ten minute walk from the start of the main street shops in town and situated in a nice quiet neighbourhood with lots of historic buildings.
5166530: This lovely little cottage is a great place to stay while exploring Broken Hill. It had everything we needed, was very clean. Checkin was easy and the host communicated with us in a timely manner. Would stay here again if we come back to the area.
153703632: Ten out of ten.... stylish ...comfortable ... immaculately clean ... just loved our stay. Would have stayed longer if we could
95757289: The cottage was nice, clean  and comfortable. We enjoyed our stay.  Highly recommended. Everything was made easy, communication great
33186323:
This house is a perfect place to stay in Broken Hill, it has everything you need and more. Beautifully clean, it looks and feels great, and very comfortable.
Location is quiet but still a short walk or easy drive to the centre of town. Would definitely stay here again!
173979190: A comfortable and spacious renovated cottage with all "mod-cons".
4508818: Ben and Emma’s cottage was just what we wanted for our 5 night stay in Broken Hill. It gives you an authentic experience in a very quiet street. They have decorated it thoughtfully and the kitchen and bathroom updates make their cottage very comfortable. The beds are comfortable. We appreciated the air con in the living area and the oil heater for the bedroom especially as the temperatures dropped overnight. We did have a minor issue with the TV but instant communication with Ben and Emma who persisteted until we found a solution was really great. They followed up to ensure that the fix we used still worked. Great service. The cottage is about a 30 min walk into town or a 5 min drive so having a car might be helpful. Thank you for letting us enjoy your lovely cottage.
240102121: Ben & Emma’s holiday home was amazing!!!! The house was sparkling clean and contained everything that is needed while away. I highly recommend this house to anyone looking to stay in Broken Hill. I will definitely stay here again.
259060471:
Modern amenities. Thought given to everything you could need during your stay. Very comfortable bed. 
Plenty of resources for information about the area. 
Very good communication.
24187605: We a were very happy in Ben and Emma's place. We liked that the exterior of the house and its yard were "authentic" to Broken Hill, yet the interior was modern and well appointed. The kitchen was especially well appointed with everything that could be needed and all was of high quality.  We enjoyed the use of the barbi and the parrots in the trees. Evenings, nights, and mornings were cool, so we appreciated the  room heaters and the heat lamp in the bathroom. We would certainly stay here again if we come back to Broken Hill.

32192074: This beautiful old miners cottage dates back to 1916 and is situated on the outskirts of Broken Hill, though is only a few minutes away from the best that this town has to offer. The cottage is perfect for travelers needing a home away from home and suits couples, single travelers, families (with kids) & furry friends. We wanted it to be a simple place to stay, for the whole family. '

19336082: Although we didn't meet Adam he was a great host, ensuring we had everything we needed for our stay. The cottage is old, but has what you need to be comfortable. We enjoyed having breakfast on the sunny front porch.
143124466: Absolutely fantastic! Great hospitality and service.
247550099: Super comfy bed and pillows. Well stocked with essentials. Very clean. Recommend parking in the front yard overnight (front gate can be opened, enter via footpath). Plenty of character yet modern. Great fireplace. We had a very nice stay, thank you.
261288600: Nice place and just what my family and I needed for the night
242236012: Extra Pillow in main Bedroom please
213983825: Newton Cottage, on the edge of town, was a really good place to stay in Broken Hill. It was clean, reasonably well-equipped and large enough for 4 people to be comfortable. We enjoyed our stay there.
27127003: Adam has been great with communication and the check-in was clear and simple. The place is really quaint, and has everything you need for your stay. We were only in Broken Hill for one night, but I think this would be a great place to stay a few nights and feel at home. The sunset view from the front of the house was amazing.
26821937: A lovely old cottage that's very clean and tidy and great for us and our dog! While the house is on a heavy vehicle route we did not constantly hear vehicles and definitely not woken up at any time. It was quite a handy location as it made it a very easy trip out to Silverton and Cockburn as well as a short throw from the town centre.
23219223: Adam has been fantastic to communicate with.
141629342: Right on the edge of Broken Hill and a lovely rustic charm
30888380: We enjoyed our stay in this air Bnb. It had everything we needed and it very cute. It’s an old place so I think you need to book expecting that but we had a lovely time and so did our dog Peggy. We are also a big fan of the tiles in the bathroom :-)

24761291: This cottage provides such a homefeeling as soon as you enter that it will be difficult to leave. It has an enclosed verandah offering a sun drenched reading nook and breakfast area. It has lovely street appeal with  a fragrant garden.  The cottage offers separate rooms allowing for alone time if sharing accommodation for work. The kitchen is compact and offers everything you need. The yard is secure for fur babies.  It sleeps 4 guests in 2 bedrooms that have wall to wall storage.'

17983304: A comfortable place with facilities for traveller - easy car access to local sights.

30355416: Tidy one bedroom unit with R/Cycle, 42inch flat screen, private ensuite, secure off road parking, Fold up camp chairs for that relaxing out of town moment.very close to the centre of town, fridge, sofa bed,Wi Fi & Privacy.'

240240695: This place is right up there with the best Motels, highly recommend
225971175: Pleasant space. Very clean and friendly
10628903: This is a great appartment, everything we could possibly need. We were there in the winter and it was cosy and warm. The most comfortable bed ever, big fluffy towels and beautiful linen. Off street parking and an easy walk to town and restaurants. Thanks Peter and Deb for your hospitality
25715273: Your own little private pocket right in the middle of Broken Hill. Comfy bed, good heating and clean. Perfect base for all your adventures
261494300: This is a great place to stay. Accomodation is perfect and reasonably priced. Situated close to the Main Street area is a bonus. Located in a quiet area with off-the street parking. Fantastic hosts who are there to help you in any way.
250619283: Well equipped little flat.  Comfy bed & good air conditioner.  Clean & tidy, close to town.
219995816: What a cozy and centrally located Apartment in Broken Hill! The bed is very comfy, lovely big towels and was lovely having the AC, Netflix and secure car parking. Great location! Would stay again :)
21108698: Very comfortable place in a great location for exploring Broken Hill and excellent communicative hosts.
90913967: The accommodation was really good! They put a lot of thought into it and had plenty of small touches (a Netflix account under my name, Easter eggs due to being Easter etc.). It was a really nice experience staying here and would highly recommend it!
22142477: Lisa welcomed us as Debbie was away. The unit was exceptionally clean and comfortable with lots of additional features such as a coffee machine, toaster, microwave, crockery and cutlery as well as some chocolate treats in the fridge. We really enjoyed our stay and would highly recommend it.
24503932: Neat and clean, walk to CBD.
11425755: Debbie's is a well appointed and impeccably clean independent place in an excellent location close to everything in Broken Hill. Great place to stay.
53671619: Good location with all amenities you need
245512984: Debbie and Peter it was pleasure meeting both of you and share local knowledge. The accomodation you offered was spacious, clean, comfortable and had everything i needed, including own off street parking with remote gate and private access. I look forward to my next visit. Thanks again for being a great host.
219543369: Excellent apartment. Great place to stay
244827900: Fantastic little flat, exceptionally clean, quality Sheridan bedding, great air-con, very comfortable and the off street parking with remote control gate was fantastic. Very accommodating hosts. Highly recommended .
86267312: Debbie and Peter were EXCELLENT hosts. We were only there for one night but they made us feel so at home. Would definitely recommend to anyone heading through Broken Hill. The room is gorgeous and has everything you need and the bed is INSANELY comfortable. So good we asked what brand it was.

23507951: Ityour home away from home and ideal if you are working, holidaying for any length of time or an overnight stay on the way through to your destination.This cottage accommodation is unique in Broken Hill - it has an in-ground pool. 212122030: Great cottage - had everything we needed. Leelee is generous with her offerings and easy to communicate with. Would definitely stay again - thank you :-)

22216247: A MINER'S REST - PRESERVING OUR PAST

OUR CHARMING, HISTORICAL, STONE MINERCOTTAGE GIVES YOU THE AMBIENCE OF YESTERYEAR BUT WITH ALL MODERN COMFORTS . Step back into Broken Hillpast with a country cottage that is always presented in a SPOTLESS condition and that will be a special experience for you, your family and friends.'

233708145: Cosy and rustic retreat in the outback on the quieter side of town. Air con is exceptional at cooling the house down quickly and effectively which was what we needed after a long day out in the heat. Only need to bring yourself and whatever food you want otherwise everything is provided.
7344674:
Was a great comfortable place to stay. 
Would highly recommended to anyone.
319951: Such a cute cottage with lots of charming touches. Fabulous spa bath, very warm and cosy, superior bedding. Comfortable snug lounge. We didn't cook while we were there. A few basics were in the fridge so you could have some toast and tea in the morning.
82036095: Nice cottage, quiet spot, nice garden. Laundry facilities great. Very cosy inside. Friendly communication. Easy check-in and check-out. Kitchen well equipped, also nice to have some essential groceries provided. We had a lovely holiday in Broken Hill.
128044277:
Was a lovely time spent in Broken Hill! We had one really hot day but the air con worked amazingly quick!
Comfortable accommodation for our family!
164228655: Intricately detailed and unique experience. A lot of effort is put in to the presentation of this unit, and the hosts provide a lot of useful information for things to see and do in Broken Hill.

21145769: Cosy Cottage  (holiday home) short or long term

10 minute stroll to Patton St Village where you will find your basic shops including a newsagency corner Deli,  Fish & chip shops and Broken Hills famous Bells Milk Bar, and the Southern Hotel. The house is a cosy cottage but big enough to host 6. The house is also newly renovatedHouse is split into 2 parts with 2 bedrooms plus living room and kitchen located up the top and 1 bedroom washhouse toilet and bathroom including back door is located down 3 steps leading to the back of the house'

263355478: Good value for a large group or family. Clean and comfortable.
5540441:
Stevie's place was conveniently located on the south side of the mine. It is close to amenities (supermarket and post office). Historic Bell's Milk bar is a must see and a stone's throw away.  
The cottage is roomy, super clean and well appointed - it has everything you need for a comfortable stay in this great city of Broken Hill.   
Highly recommend Stevie's place and the host who was easy to communicate with. You definitely won't be disappointed if you choose to stay here!
217362913: Just what we needed! Thank you :)
225316356: Good place to stay for a few days of gallery hopping ...
258136943:
Place was overall tidy and clean with the bathroom requiring abit more attention. 
For what you pay to stay you can’t really complain. The shower was difficult to use, one second it would be perfect and in the next it was either scorching hot or freezing cold. This wasn’t ideal for my 2 year old niece. Other than that my family and I didn’t mind the stay.
252024889: great stay at this airbnb. Excellent for our dog to holiday with us
11908015: its exactly what it says it is. perfectly good to stay in! thanks
151332713: Well situated and appointed place. Quick communication
187890647: Well presented house and Stevie is amazing, replied very quickly with any questions and us overall very friendly.
8337478: Great for a budget stop over. Host was very responsive.

4445293: Martha's place has everything you need. Whether you are traveling or working in the area. Centrally located as well. Unfortunately I haven't met Martha since she was overseas but she had organised everything perfectly beforehand.
11022244:
Martha's place is great.
travelled to broken hill for work and felt at home.
great experience.
127397298: Great place that met all expectations    Good value!

26582266: Authentic original 1880stone miners cottage . Freshly totally renovated cottage in a very quiet convenient location. Walking distance to shops and main city area. Convenience +++'

4360065: My partner and I spent three nights at Glynis’s place and absolutely loved it! We have stayed in dozens of AiBnBs and can honestly say that this one stands out as special. Others have noted that the house is quirky (it’s a refurbished miner’s cottage) but this doesn’t do it justice. It is really  well thought out and Glynis is outstandingly generous with the breakfast provisions and snacks. Everything you might want is provided  and there are interesting, comfortable spaces both indoors and out. We’d love to come back to Broken Hill and if we do we would love to stay here again. Thanks Glynis!
260691624: This place is value for money , great location see is a local so see knows the place , yust all the food she suplied , picked us up from station & drop us off , Great host we will be back
49388026: I absolutely recommend this charming cottage, deceptively spacious, very quiet and walking distance to the city centre. We loved it.
193121260: Just a great  little cottage in a central location and walking distance into the main Broken Hill city precinct
92066711:
I highly recommend staying in Glynis's cottage which is very comfortable and has all you need (in fact more!) in all the different areas of the cottage and garden. Great location, easy walk to local shops and the main centre of Broken Hill. 
Check in was easy, Glynis popped around to introduce herself and was easily contactable if we needed her, which we didn't as all was perfect!
58245691: Great place....full of lovely touches...good location.  So relaxing, welcoming and full of style.  Would recommend it no worries.
185776102: Wonderful place to stay. Great location and the little touches and supplies were amazing. Definitely stay again.
29669379: From when Glynis greeted us at check in, we had a lovely time.  Quirky, character filled living spaces and we loved the separate room WC/shower, etc. Food provided was above and beyond, and it was super quiet. Highly recommend this Airbnb to all x
30382437: Had a lovely 2 night stay at the cottage. Glynis was very friendly, welcoming and helpful. The cottage is lovely - very well equipped and appointed, with quirky country touches. We walked into town for dinner at the Palace Hotel & a short walk in the other direction took us to the shopping centre. I would definitely recommend Glynis’ cottage.
36900566: nice place to stay in great location
75842964: Great, quirky place, in a great location with a helpful host. Will definitely stay again if we come by this part of the state in the future.
6474668: Glynis and her partner were exceptional and delightful hosts and most willing to share their time, knowledge and love of Broken Hill.  They are great ambassadors for The Far West and Australia's First Heritage City.  The cottage is within cooee of a supermarket, walking distance to many of the historic sites, museums, eateries and walking trails.  We lacked for nothing in the cottage and appreciated the thoughtful provisions as we arrived on Labor Day holiday arriving  by train from Sydney on Monday around 8pm.  A car is recommended to visit the countryside, to ensure you enjoy Silverton, a Mundi Mundi sunset, a visit to the Observatory, The Broken HIll Outback Resort for Sunday pizza and a pint and the Sculpture Walk.
71041270:
Good location but a bit of a walk to the town centre but Parking is not an issue in Broken Hill.  Shopping centre within walking distance.  Secure off street parking.

Clean, spacious and functional.
Very generous breakfast layout.  Eggs, Milk, fresh bread, Orange Juice, Jam.  All you would need for 3 nights. Good cookiong facilities.
Great outdoors area for watching the stars come out.
17262048: What a gem in Broken Hill this place is. To start it is in the main street but just enough distance from the main shopping area to make it quiet but also easy to walk to everything. The house itself is delightfully quirky seeing as the owners are artists. It is colourfully decorated and very functional. Ideal for a couple. My wife and I stayed for 4 nights and we both would recommend it and would definitely return there.
24946619: A  wonderful place everything we needed great location close to city centre All facilities in fact more than expected wonderful hosts
1613642: I can't reccomend Glenys's cottage and hospitality enough. She is a friendly, helpful host and her cottage is tidy as a pin, well supplied and beautifully decorated. My partner and I were delighted with our stay.
74403004: Great location to just easily walk into town for tourist attractions and shops. Quirky, very clean, comfortable. well equipped and spacious cottage. Well stocked condiments. Plenty of sitting areas both inside and outside. Great reading material available. Good communication with Glynis and lovely to meet her. Would stay again and highly recommend.
5333277: This historically important cottage is decorated with style and has a huge amount of space for relaxation. Glynis is a considerate and knowledgeable host who will make sure your stay is very comfortable. She provided copious breakfast fixings for us which was a welcome and thoughtful touch. Highly recommended!

34171067: A place to rest your head
Clean affordable and basic accomodation, close to Broken Hill aquatic centre, playgrounds, takeaway shop and corner delis'
33894754: Newly renovated home, from top to toe.2 Queen bedrooms with walk in robe, each with an extra sinle bed.1 single bedroom with 2 single beds.Open plan living, BBQ area, 4 car carport, private yard. All creature comforts of home.'

140858690: This was way above our expectations a beautiful modern home.5 Star in our books . Would definitely stay again.
231586335: House was clean, tidy and spacious for the 6 of us. Everything had a new feel. Wish we had stayed there on the way through the first time and will definitely be recommending it to people I know going through broken hill
240910616: Lovely house with plenty of space for 6. Easy to drive into town.

We will be back again soon.

Scarlett, Braidy & Mally X
185776102: Great little cottage with some beautiful history.  Loved the king sized bed and the bath!
2461258: Good access to Broken Hill in quaint cottage. Interesting to read the history of the house and previous inhabitants.
26338430: A beautifully decorated home that “feels” right. The owners must be collectors. We enjoyed outdoor dining at this time of year and it was fascinating to read the history of the house. Highly recommended.

Great place - convenient location, quiet and well looked after. Wonderful atmosphere and everything you need is available. Comfortable and with charm.

8242619: This is a very comfortable house with good amenities. Excellent beds. Good spot in Broken Hill.

123163711: A gorgeous house with lots of history and charm! Plenty of room and very clean with a friendly host
46588018: Ella's place is a delight to see, visit and stay in.  The house encapsulates everything one woukd expect from a home of this period.
91423060: You’ll be cosy and comfortable at Ella’s. Quaint & cute furnishings and nice and close to the highlights Broken Hill has to offer.
26762362:
This is a beautiful and quirky place to stay in. Full of amazing objects and memorabilia, it feels like your staying in a historic house!
The outside area was beautiful, and a lovely space to sit and have breakfast in.
139910473: Full of character and well fitted out. Our family loved it.
23470991: Staying here really made our stay in Broken Hill more authentic!  The history of the house was great to learn and to see all the memorabilia around the house was so nice.  My little ones enjoyed staying here, sleeping in the big beds and the light in the toilet :D  Would highly recommend Ella's and visiting Broken Hill with little kids.

8799574: Emaroo Argent - Miners Cottage Pet Friendly

Emaroo Argent is a fully self contained three bedroom  cottage with full kitchen facilities, heating and cooling, suitable for families with two queen size bedrooms and one room with two single beds.Large secure backyard and parking. Close to city.'

240302581: We had a wonderful time in a great cottage, thoroughly recommend staying here. We would book again with Cathy if we came back
79963857: Everything was great, except all the price labels on beer/coke/wine. We understand it is not the hosts responsibility to provide us with such, but it doesn’t have to feel like a transaction. Suggestions are wonderful and most people donate for the goods they use, but $6 for a beer is a joke, not to mention illegal. You do not have a liquor license. Providing kitchen aids as well to create a good meal would be awesome. Air BNB’s are like your home away from home, so it’s convenient to have sauces, oils and spices (like we have left) for your guests.
33956024: Cathy was friendly and easy to communicate with. We had a lovely stay in Broken Hill even though it was only a short visit. Thanks Cathy!!
185394663:
Very comfy central accommodation, with plenty of parking and great facilities. 
Thank you Cathy we will be back
Karen and Rob
160959477:
Clean.
when you arrive no fresh milk or bread, its just those little touches that make it feel homely, and this accommodation lacked that.
53651286: Stylish, comfortable and equipped beyond normal expectations - right down to a stroller for toddler - not that we needed it but nothing missing. Perfect
109783201: Very nice place close to town, great size sparkling clean. Great communication
1616076:
An outstanding stay.... clearly well thought out and a real drive to make our stay comfortable and enjoyable.

Communication was timely and great, and it is the little touches that make this a delight. Bold colors inspire a real holiday and luxurious feel......

Heartily recommended and our only regret that we weren’t staying longer.
167108493:
This place is SO comfortable and well appointed. And it is very easy to find.
It has everything you need. The beds are cofortable and well set up. The four of us had a great time. So much better than being in three motel rooms. Just the shot!
51881832: Great location, able to walk to Main Street easily. This place had everything we needed for our stay!
132294665: It's true you just needed your toothbrush
107305055: Nice and central, very comfortable and homely, would have loved more time there.
30247663: Cathy's place is a very comfortable home walking distance to Broken Hill's main street. Big backyard and comfy bedrooms, with kids well catered for. Thanks for having us!
37465479: Great accommodation that is centrally located. A very nice backyard outdoor area for meals, drinks etc. Cathy's prompt response to our enquiries was really appreciated.
193579540: A great home at a great price! Really felt like a home away from home and with additional amenities.

3186207: Nestled in the heart of Broken Hill, enjoy your trip to the outback in style. No roughing it here!Every modern comfort and convenience you could desire is provided, from sumptuous linens to the beautiful upright piano. You wonwant to leave!'
